snippet: President Obama and Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. both made calls to Democratic lawmakers on Thursday in an urgent effort to save a $1.1 trillion spending bill that the White House and Republicans say is a worthy compromise.

byline.original: MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

lead_paragraph: President Obama and Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. both made calls to Democratic lawmakers on Thursday in an urgent effort to save a $1.1 trillion spending bill that the White House and Republicans say is a worthy compromise.

headline.main: Obama Works the Phones to Get Funding Deal Done
